content:
The code you provided will have a similar effect, but it will only take into account the first letter of the note, and not the octave.

`note_num = 60 + (ord(note[0]) - ord('A')) + int("#" in note)` this code will check if the note contains "#" or not and if it contains "#" it will add 1 to the note value, so this will take care of the sharp notes.

However, it does not take into account the octave of the note. The notes with the same letter but different octaves will be considered the same, and this could cause confusion or errors in the final MIDI file.

Also, it assumes that the notes are in the 4th octave, which might not always be the case.
It's better to use the previous code snippet, as it's more robust and can handle different octaves and different notation of notes.
Please let me know if you have any other questions.
